title: 820 3437, Green - orange light , not turning on!
message:
Hey , 

Working on 820 3437, initial the board start, fans spins only after 30-50 sec but don't have any chime!   first impression the board is very clean but with a real inspection i noticed U7501 have a bit off humidity! pins 23-24 because off the corrosion don't do the contact component-Board! i take the U7501 reconstruct the trace and ressolder the component U7501. After this the board don't start anymore !! already replace U7501 for new on and same history, no fan!! 

i already double inspect and don't found more humidity !!! 

ppbus, PP3V42_G3H , PPVRTC_G3H, PP5V_S5, PP5V_S4RS3 - ALL OK  

 MC_ADAPTER_EN, PM_BATLOW_L, SMC_PM_G2_EN, SMC_RESET_L. - ALL OK 

only don't have PP5V_S0 !! 

any idea???

title: 820 3437, Green - orange light , not turning on!
message:
U7501 controls only PP5V_S4RS3, not PP5V_S0.
PP5V_S0 is generated by U8080, controlled by PM_SLP_S3, via U8180.

Do you miss more voltages?

title: 820 3437, Green - orange light , not turning on!
message: You right, missing PP5V_S4RS3! have 0V on this point!! i pull this line when i measuring the board!

title: 820 3437, Green - orange light , not turning on!
message: On this line is pulsing 0v - 1.6 , 0V - 4V....

title: 820 3437, Green - orange light , not turning on!
message:
Other coils pulsing?
Is always better to use o-scope, to check pulses...
Normal DC multimeter will not catch the peak value.

title: 820 3437, Green - orange light , not turning on!
message: yes, L7320, L7310,L7630, L7430 pulsing too!!

title: 820 3437, Green - orange light , not turning on!
message: What about U1950, pins 7 & 3?

title: 820 3437, Green - orange light , not turning on!
message: Ya, all pin's are pulsing!! u1950 problem??

title: 820 3437, Green - orange light , not turning on!
message: but this area looks well!! don't have corrosion !!

title: 820 3437, Green - orange light , not turning on!
message:
"all pin's are pulsing"
Do you mean pin8 pulsing too?
There is PP3V42_G3H, should be stable...

Check now all the SPI termination resistors.
Also check traces around U6100, try new BIOS...

Inspect carefully the area where you worked first time, around U7501.
Maybe some resistor/trace affected close to it.

title: 820 3437, Green - orange light , not turning on!
message: i means pin 7 & 3. Pin 8 3.4V stable! ok, 2informaticos i will check!! thank you for your's reply

title: 820 3437, Green - orange light , not turning on!
message: You hit full, Bios problem! i replace a bios for another donor board and the machine comes to life!! but, now i need a BIOS! i will update a original bios here!

title: 820 3437, Green - orange light , not turning on!
message:
Is this original dump?
"clean" name put me in doubts; a dump from booted board is not clean anymore...
